features: Heavy Duty: Redrope Covers With A Double-Reinforced Flap Are Built To Withstand Heavy Use Over Weeks And Months And Years
Go Ahead, Get Started: One Row Of Pre-Printed A-Z Tabs Will Have You Sorting And Filing Right Out Of The Gate; Another Row Of Blank Tabs Allows You To Personalize Sections For Your Needs
Flap & Elastic Cord Closure: This System Ensures Your Papers Are Secure While You Store, Carry Or Transport Them
Room To Expand: Expanding Sides Grow As Your Files Grow; Tyvek Reinforced Top Edges Keep Even Over-Stuffed Files In Tact
body.description: Pendaflex Heavy-Duty Expanding Files help you safely organize and transport large amounts of paper. These heavy-duty expanding files have extra-thick covers, Tyvek reinforcements at the top edge, and an elastic cord closure to keep contents secure. Pre-printed A–Z tabs help you go from piled to filed without labels, stickers, tab inserts, permanent markers or fuss. Don't overlook the classics! This simple accordion folder is a great starter tool for an organization overhaul.21-Pocket Heavy Duty Expanding File. Letter Sized.Indispensible in the Office: Lawyers, accountants, tax preparers and busy offices everywhere sort and control fast-growing files with the use of expanding file foldersProjects are Conquered: Apply the office strategy at home to keep mortgage documents in one place or to store receipts for tax season; instruction manuals, bills by vendor;the opportunities to master paper management are endlessStart with Simple, Economical Solutions: There are countless organizational tools to help you tame clutter but none more intuitive or cost-effective than Pendaflex expanding filesFumbling to find the right file? An organized desk will dramatically boost your productivity and leave the right impression with those waiting patientlyStock Up for Big Filing Jobs: Keep a few on hand for your next big de-clutter project or to triage filing hotspots as needed

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Pendaflex Heavy Duty Expanding File with Extra-Thick Cover Extra-thick covers. Double reinforced flap and elastic cord closure. Transport documents safely. Index dividers to organize files into sub-categories. Rip-proof Tyvek reinforcement at gusset top and corners. 1/3 cut pre-printed and blank tabs aligned straight for easy viewing. 21 pockets. A-Z tabs. Letter size.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2016
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Been using these for years and still order new ones when needed.
reviews.reviewText: I can remember my Dad using these when I was a kid a long time ago. Like most folks these days I have pretty much computerized just about everything. Now computers are suppose to cut pack on the paperwork we produce yet I seem to be having the opposite affect. Every day I receive E-mails, computer generated faxes, billing and payment receipts. Some of this is important and some is not even worth printing and saving. The material that I find important enough to print and save goes into these Pendaflex folders. The two I ordered are replacements for ten or more year old folders that finically wore out after a lot of use and abuse. I find them extremely useful for other things besides daily paperwork. I have one for appliance instruction books and warranties. I have another for clippings and research. I have one just for everything needed for my eventual death including will, complete info on accounts, account numbers, vechicle forms, prepaid funeral arrangements, living will, medical information and Power of Attornies. My wife use to keep recipes she cut from magazine and news papers. My daughter kept all her school art work from grade school right throug college. My granddaughter now has her own folder for her important stuff. I guess I could go on and on but I believe you get the idea.Plenty of partitions, plenty strong and priced very well. Some of the ones I have are nearly 35 years of age and older. They hold up great. There are two minor reasons why I gave these 4 stars. Comparing these new folders to my older folders I believe they have shrunk a bit. They are also a bit heavy. Other than that if needed I'll reorder again.This review was written without any financial considerations. Full Amazo retail was paid.

reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect number of pockets
reviews.reviewText: I really like this file folder. Not only does it have monthly pockets, but also other pockets you can customize to your needs. Unlike some others, it also has a flap with an elastic band to secure the receipts inside.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024
Reviewed in the United States on October 23, 2017
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars A classic, not so good for manila folders though.
reviews.reviewText: This is the classic expanding file. Pretty sturdy for a cardboard product. Nifty cover and super bungie.I do wish they made one 3/4" wider so I could use my manila folders (which come 11 5/8" wide) - I scissored them down to exactly 11".Also, the huge tabs in this product covered up 2/3 of my manila folder tabs - I trimmed the tabs with scissors: not a fun job, even for an OC guy like me. (Your probably don't want to trim them completely off: they are handy for finger-walking through the dividers.)Product Wish: a fully expandable file holder, durable synthetic material, handles (and cinch straps), wide enough (and tall enough) for manila folders with adjustable placement clear plastic inserts for the dividers (like in hanging folders), with an "accordion" design that doesn't interfere with the contents, stands comfortably upright when expanded, compacts neatly (without warping) when compressed and cinched.
I couldn't find a A-Z file anywhere locally so I ordered this one. Works good, it does the job.
I use it to hold cardboard pieces for a board game and it feels great. Quality product.
Completely incompatible for use for most files. Does not fit A4 pages.....

El producto es de cartón, es elaborado por una marca mexicana y es muy útil para organizar archivos por orden alfabético. Su mayor ventaja en mi opinión es que tiene 21 separadores cuando la mayoría de estos organizadores cuenta con 13 o 12. El cartón se ve resistente sin embargo tampoco es muy grueso y no podría decir que pueda durar varios años. Lo compré a un precio excelente por 77 pesos, que me parece muy justo sin embargo no pagaría más de 100 por el producto
